entry.title: The Purple Prince ( The Purple Challenge)

media:group.media:title: The Purple Prince ( The Purple Challenge)
media:group.media:description:
The rules for The Purple Challenge:
1) Click on this link, HOWEVER, YOU CAN NOT READ THE STORY AHEAD OF TIME! https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ClQzUMXRr1qasqJ0k08B8QtosDQzfNHEMVB5D6LQ5S4/edit 2) Record yourself reading the whole story from start to finish with an as little laughing and mistakes as possible
3) You can ONLY use the VERY FIRST TAKE
4) Do not make ANY edits or alterations to the one recording you have
5) Upload it and give the video the name of "The Purple Prince (aka. The Purple Challenge)"
Unfortunately, the link to The Purple Prince a.k.a The Purple Challenge videos Playlist is not available, so instead I've gathered a list of some of my favourite ones here:
The LostNarrator: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FObWF90_mS8
Thornquill Audiofics: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7psGlnTHjxM
Scribbler Productions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUPBMNZfgCo
RaeBae Cosplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R0WvKX7c4Jo
Illya Leonov AKA Morgan Free pony: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lpBHq9ZkmeY
HELIUM EDITION: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0joXr_yTOMs
DeftFunk: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Hyw60QAVcg
Lulu Luvscats (I'm not sure if this counts, but I like it a lot, so here you go): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Af8dkVIPKIc

entry.title: Finnish Grammar Structure: congruence(agreement) of the attributes with headword

media:group.media:title: Finnish Grammar Structure: congruence(agreement) of the attributes with headword
media:group.media:description: Finnish Grammar Structure: congruence(agreement) of the attributes with headword. we will learn the Finnish grammar structure where the attribute of the word found in front of the word is the same case and number as the headword

entry.title: The Attributes of Finnish Words You Should Know

media:group.media:title: The Attributes of Finnish Words You Should Know
media:group.media:description: The Attributes of Finnish Words You Should Know: The attribute is a qualifier for nouns, The attribute is most often in front of the headword.

media:group.media:title: Past Tense in Finnish
media:group.media:description: Past Tense In Finnish, Miten suomeksi puhutaan menneisyydest√§? Now we can learn something new - how to talk about the past in Finnish!learn a simple way, on how to change present to past tense. An easy and fast way to learn and develop your Finnish language skills.

entry.title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Orders and instructions in Finnish

media:group.media:title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Orders and instructions in Finnish
media:group.media:description: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Orders and instructions in Finnish Osaatko k√§ske√§ suomeksi? Can you give orders / instructions in Finnish? like a native Finnish speaker even like learning Finnish while you sleep in this section you can learn the imperative when talking to one person - both positive forms (e.g. "Talk!") and negative forms (e.g. "Don't talk!")

entry.title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Demonstratiivipronominit

media:group.media:title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Demonstratiivipronominit
media:group.media:description: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Demonstratiivipronominit:A demonstrative pronoun is a little word used with a noun that can substitute it. It can state something about the place of something, when talking about concrete things. learn Finnish Demonstratiivipronominit ( demonstrative pronouns) learn Finnish while you sleep #personal pronouns in finnish #finnish while you sleeping #finnish grammar

entry.title: Is Finnish Language Hard To Learn:cases that determine LOCATION

media:group.media:title: Is Finnish Language Hard To Learn:cases that determine LOCATION
media:group.media:description: Is Finnish Language Hard To Learn: cases that determine LOCATION. As we know in Finnish there are no prepositions like ‚ÄúIn‚Äù, ‚Äúfrom‚Äù or ‚Äúto‚Äù. So instead, we add endings to the words. And in the case of location, we need to distinguish, whether the location is in a closed space or open space.

entry.title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Housing in Finland

media:group.media:title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: Housing in Finland
media:group.media:description: Learn Finnish While You Sleep: housing in Finland Miss√§ sin√§ asut? Where do you live In this section we will talk about housing.we are going to learn about housing notices or housing advertising and what they mean. First we will start with the types of Residence (Asuminen) you can find in Finland and more importantly when searching for accommodation in Finland. then learn some housing terms used in housing adverts and notices.

media:group.media:title: Finnish For Beginners :small words
media:group.media:description: Finnish For Beginners: Do you know some "small words" in Finnish? In this lesson we‚Äôll be looking at some small words in Finnish and sentences with further explanations of these words and their use :) for example No niin! Which means *SO* which in this context is often said just before you‚Äôre about to do something and ‚Äúlhan tosi‚Äù means really. The link to the info for the play I'm acting in is at here: https://maneeri.fi/sumu/ The link to buying the ticket reservations online is here: https://www.ideaticket.fi/servlet/ideaticket/maneeri/ The premiere performance is on Saturday 30.10.2021 19:00 o'clock at "Theater Maneeri" in the city of Turku

entry.title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep:Mit√§ kielt√§ sin√§ puhut?

media:group.media:title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep:Mit√§ kielt√§ sin√§ puhut?
media:group.media:description: Learn Finnish While You Sleep:Mit√§ kielt√§ sin√§ puhut? What Language do you speak? So we are going to talk about languages and how to respond to the question of what language do you speak. In Finnish often times the name of the language is the same as the name of the country, but note the name of the language is always written with a lower case letter and the name of the country with a capital letter which is different from English

entry.title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep:Country and nationality

media:group.media:title: Learn Finnish While You Sleep:Country and nationality
media:group.media:description: Learn Finnish While You Sleep:Country and nationality¬†For this lesson, we will have a closer look at these three topics: country, nationality and languages and how to express those in Finnish. Part 1: Country and nationality¬†(Osa 1: Maa ja kansalaisuus) First let us begin with the kind of question we can ask, if we want to know someone. Kuka sin√§ olet ( who are you) Mist√§ sin√§ olet kotoisin? ( where are you from?) Mink√§ maalainen sin√§ olet? (What is your nationality?) Mit√§ kielt√§ sin√§ puhut? ( What language do you speak?)
